content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function in Julia that should accomplish what you're asking for:
```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    code_blocks = String[]
    in_julia_block = false

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, ~s\"`````julia")
            in_julia_block = true
            (code_blocks === nothing())
                code_blocks = [String[]] 
            push!(code_blocks, String[])
            continue
        elseif startswith(line, ~s\"\"\") && in_julia_block
            in_julia_block = false
            continue;
        elseif in_julia_block 
            push!(code_blocks[(end)],string (line))    
        end
    end
    code = String[]
    for in (code_blocks)
        s = string (join(in, \"\n"))
        push!(code, s)
    end;
    replace(string(join(code, \"\n\n\"), \""\"), ~s\"\"\"));
end
```
